Description: Papyrus written with black ink with demotic legal text on recto (15 ll.) and names of 8 witnesses on verso. Thompson's MS Catalogue: "Loan of corn made by a Greek of Ptolemais to five persons, one of whom is a man of Philae & another a Nubian. Date. year 6 Choiak 18 of Ptol. Philometor = B.C. 175 Jan 21 (In fact probably year 6 of joint reign = 15 Jan. 164 BC)".
Curator's comments: Kaplony-Heckel, U., Das Getreide-Darlehn P. Haun. Inv. Demot. 2, in K. Ryhol (ed.), Acts of the seventh international conference of Demotic studies. Copenhagen, 2002, 244. Cf. entry in www.trismegistos.org - DAHT. Text 7 in Shore's Manuscript Catalogue of Demotic Gebelein Papyri in the British Museum. Publication in progress (C J Martin).
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (661) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/661)
Condition: Papyrus Survey: Condition Details: Papyrus: fractured, loss, delaminating Black ink Backed: brown paper Mount Details: Sandwich: glass Sandwich: board Window verso Binding: cloth Object Priority: B Mount Priority: A Overall Condition: B Curatorial condition comment: fair (incomplete)
